;;复合图像。 2023 年 9 月 10 日，在社交媒体上获得的这张静态图片中，一条红酒河穿过葡萄牙阿纳迪亚的一条街道。 Instagram @pitstore223/via REUTERS 此图片由第三方提供。强制性信用。禁止转售。没有档案。
;

;周末，葡萄牙小镇莱维拉的酒精在当地酒厂里自由流动，当地一家酿酒厂的两个装有约 220 万升葡萄酒的大桶发生爆炸，淹没了街道。

;

;网上发布的图片和视频显示，红酒——几乎足以填满一个奥林匹克规模的游泳池——沿着葡萄牙中部阿纳迪亚莱维拉的街道涌出。

; ;

;“我们对今天早上发生的事件深感遗憾，”Destilaria Levira 在其 Facebook 上的一篇帖子中表示。周日页面;。 “我们对造成的总体损失表示诚挚的关注。”该公司表示，正在调查破裂原因，并承担清理工作的全部责任。

;

;据当地媒体报道，葡萄酒流下附近的道路，淹没了土地和至少一个地窖。当地消防员帮助清理，可以收集的液体被运至废水处理厂。

;

;当地议会的一名成员告诉我们，防止了葡萄酒流入河流，避免了环境灾难;新闻日报;。

;

;泄漏持续了大约一个小时，但没有留下强烈的气味，因为这是“优质葡萄酒”，酿酒厂首席执行官佩德罗·卡瓦略;告诉纽约时报;.

;

;一个坦克由于“结构性故障”而倒塌，他说，那股酒流的力量击倒了第二个大桶。

;

;这些大桶已经被使用过酿酒厂表示，为了储存多余的葡萄酒。葡萄牙，;以及法国等其他葡萄酒生产国;，由于消费下降等原因，现在出现供应过剩。

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 09:52:01 +0800 Descendants of enslaved people fight against ‘erasure’ of their historical landhttps://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/sep/12/slave-descendants-preservation-land-georgia-gullah-geechee
;;2023-09-13T01:35:07Z;
;
;;轧棉厂工人的黑白图像
;

;230 多年乔治亚州海岸外的萨佩洛岛是古拉吉奇人的一个小社区的家园。 Hogg Hammock 是岛上这些被奴役者后裔居住的地区，是一个占地 427 英亩的沿海社区，有 40 名居民，自 1996 年以来一直被指定为历史遗址。这意味着建造超过 1,400 平方英尺的房屋和为了保护岛屿社区，严禁任何道路铺设或拆除财产。

;
;

;;相关：;; 亚特兰大警方在“警察城”工地逮捕了五名被锁在推土机上的活动人士;

;
;

;周二主持萨佩洛的麦金托什县专员投票决定取消霍格哈莫克的分区限制。 Gullah-Geechee 居民担心，富裕的移民想要开发更大的房屋，并可能迫使当地提高财产税，从而取代他们并颠覆他们的生计。

;

;该县的白人人口占 65%，已投票删除承认霍格哈莫克地区“对其历史资源有独特需求”的官方语言。它还将打击应防止“土地价值上涨，这可能迫使土著居民迁移”的措辞。

;

;此次投票代表了县官员与历史悠久的黑人小社区之间的最新争端。早在 2012 年，霍格哈莫克 (Hogg Hammock) 居民就曾抗议该县提高财产税，随后该县又取消了财产税。 2015年，该社区向联邦法院起诉该县，指控该县未能为居民提供足够的服务，从而对他们进行种族歧视。该岛居民为学校、警察和消防部门以及垃圾收集服务缴纳了县税，但这些税款都没有延伸到萨佩洛岛。该县去年解决了诉讼，同意为一些居民提供紧急和道路服务，并冻结财产税。

; ;

;上周四，数十名居民< a href="https://thecurrentga.org/2023/09/10/commission-to-discuss-changes-at-sapelo-protest-planned/">;为该县分区委员会的争论提供了数小时的证词;反对拟议的变更，并警告说该县未经社区考虑就仓促做出了变更。雷金纳尔·霍尔 (Reginal Hall) 是一名地主，其家族起源于霍格·哈莫克 (Hogg Hummock)，他;告诉;美联社县政府的批准将相当于“抹去 230 年后仍然完好无损的历史文化”。

;

;居民和;州立法者;呼吁该县推迟投票并在 90 天内反思提议的变更。 “我们不会允许我们的文化历史被抹去或以土地开发商的价格购买，”代表亚特兰大的州代表金·斯科菲尔德;新闻发布会告诉记者;。 “这是我们的历史和遗产，我们将努力保护它。”

;

;霍尔警告说，该县取消开发限制的投票将使霍格哈莫克的 Gullah-Geechee 居民仅“两到三年大多数人”在分散到其他地方之前先在该县生存，正如 20 万古拉吉奇人已经穿越美国东南部走廊所做的那样。 “如果你谈论被奴役的后代，”她说，“我们 90% 的人都会消失。”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 09:52:01 +0800 Kim Jong-un expected to hold weapons talks with Putin at remote Russian space basehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/kim-jong-un-putin-weapons-talk-russian-space-base-amur
;;2023-09-13T01:42:44Z;
;
;;朝鲜领导人金正恩在抵达哈桑火车站前与滨海边疆区州长奥列格·科热米亚科握手与弗拉基米尔·普京总统会面
;

;金正恩谈到了他访问俄罗斯的“战略重要性”，预计将于 2019 年 12 月 12 日与弗拉基米尔·普京在阿穆尔偏远地区的太空基地举行武器会谈。周三。

;

; 据国营新通讯社朝中社报道，朝鲜领导人抵达俄罗斯后受到贵宾欢迎，有军事仪仗队，奏两国国歌。据报道，金正恩告诉俄罗斯东道主，他的访问“明确表明”朝鲜“优先考虑”与俄罗斯关系的战略重要性。

;

;金正恩乘坐私人装甲列车抵达卡桑车站，从;朝鲜;通往俄罗斯远东地区的主要铁路门户，金正恩在这里被拍摄到下车并与俄罗斯环境部长亚历山大·科兹洛夫会面，然后继续向北行驶。

;
;

;;相关：;;粉色皮革扶手椅和防弹地板：金正恩内部- 联合国的装甲列车;

;
;

;据报道，金正恩在军火工业和军事高级官员的陪同下恢复了行程，并可能于周三在俄罗斯港口举行的东方经济论坛结束后与普京会面符拉迪沃斯托克市，;普京所在地已经抵达;。

;

;从他的装甲列车目前的行驶路线来看，他不会像之前预计的那样访问符拉迪沃斯托克，而是前往更北边的偏远阿穆尔地区。普京表示，他将于周三访问该地区的东方航天发射场，该太空基地将为两位领导人举行峰会提供安全场所。

;

;记者获准在符拉迪沃斯托克论坛上采访俄罗斯领导人没有向普京询问此次访问的细节，但总统告诉记者，他很快就会前往东方航天发射场，这是一个距离符拉迪沃斯托克约 1,000 公里（620 英里）的俄罗斯航天发射场。

;

;“我在那里有我的计划，当我到达那里你就会知道，”俄罗斯新闻机构援引他的话说。

;

;航天发射场将成为两个孤立的领导人在军事和航空航天领域建立合作的象征性场所。朝鲜多次太空发射均告失败，可能会寻求俄罗斯的援助，将其间谍卫星送入轨道。但迄今为止会议地点和时间尚未确定。

;

;西方担心平壤计划向莫斯科提供武器，以补充在18个月的战斗中严重耗尽的库存在;乌克兰;。

;

;弹药短缺迫使卡内基国际和平基金会俄罗斯与欧亚项目高级研究员迈克尔·科夫曼表示，俄罗斯将节约炮弹和火箭，实行每日火力限制，并更多地关注精确制导弹药而不是火力。 “俄罗斯正在动员生产，但产量将远远低于他们的需求，”他说。 “因此，他们可能会从任何可以帮助弥补赤字的来源寻求进口。” 斯德哥尔摩国际和平研究所高级研究员西蒙·韦泽曼表示，北方“完全有可能”韩国拥有大量可供俄罗斯使用的弹药库存。

;

;“是否达成任何协议还有待观察，”他说。他补充道：“除非有确凿的证据表明俄罗斯在乌克兰战场上使用了朝鲜的武器和弹药，否则我们无法确定。”

;

;金正恩还可能寻求急需的能源和食品供应。据俄罗斯新闻机构报道，俄罗斯外交部副部长安德烈·鲁登科表示，俄罗斯官员可能会与朝鲜代表团讨论人道主义援助问题。

;

;白宫上周警告称，如果朝鲜不采取行动，朝鲜将“付出代价”分析人士称，金正恩正在与包括朝鲜人民军元帅朴正天和军需工业部部长赵春龙在内的高级军事官员一起前往俄罗斯。首尔朝鲜研究大学校长杨武镇告诉法新社，这表明普京与金正恩峰会“可能会重点关注俄罗斯和朝鲜可能的军事合作”。< /p>;

;周一，美国称普京迫切希望与金正恩会面。

;

;“必须穿越自己的国家去会见一位国际贱民，以寻求与金正恩会面的机会。”美国国务院发言人马修·米勒 (Matthew Miller) 表示：“如果他希望在第一个月内赢得一场战争的援助，我会将其描述为他在乞求援助。”

;

;莫斯科和平壤都否认朝鲜已经或将会这样做向俄罗斯供应武器，自去年初发动乌克兰攻势以来，俄罗斯已经耗尽了其大量弹药库存。

;

;自冠状病毒大流行开始以来，金正恩就没有出过朝鲜。他最后一次正式的海外访问是在 2019 年，也是去俄罗斯会见普京。

;

;首尔国民大学朝鲜问题专家安德烈·兰科夫 (Andrei Lankov) 告诉法新社，即将举行的会面是莫斯科“温和的外交勒索”的一部分首尔是因为俄罗斯不希望韩国向基辅供应武器。

;

;首尔是主要武器出口国，已向基辅的盟友波兰出售坦克，但长期的国内政策禁止其向活跃冲突出售武器兰科夫表示：“俄罗斯政府现在主要担心的是韩国弹药可能会运往乌克兰，而且不是一批，而是大量。”

;

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 09:52:01 +0800 Hunt for nearly 70 crocodiles that escaped during China floodshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/13/crocodiles-escape-china-floods
;;2023-09-12T23:47:22Z;

;;鳄鱼档案照片。
;

;中国某城市发起了寻找大量鳄鱼的行动当局称，最近几天洪水袭击该地区时有鳄鱼逃跑。

;

;;上周台风给华南地区带来持续暴雨;，引发香港等地区内涝。

; <据当地媒体报道，广东省茂名市周围的洪水导致商业鳄鱼养殖场的一个湖水泛滥，70 多只鳄鱼逃走了。在彭村发现鳄鱼后，当地政府曾一度警告村民留在室内。

;
;

;;相关：;;香港价值数百万美元的悬崖豪宅濒临倒塌创纪录的降雨之后;

;
;

;当地应急管理办公室的一位发言人周二告诉法新社，官员们正在“努力处理”爬行动物逃跑的问题。

;

;该人士没有透露仍有多少只动物逍遥法外，也没有透露目前是否已找到任何动物，但中国官方媒体报道称，已有八只动物被抓获。据报道，一些人被枪杀或触电。

;

;国家支持的《新京报》发布的一段视频显示，身穿红色制服的救援人员在救援船上搜寻被洪水淹没的田地。其他图像显示，几条两米长的鳄鱼躺在路上，它们的下巴被繁文缛节紧紧捆住。

;

;“鳄鱼仍在水中，多个政府部门正在努力捕捉它们，”中央人民广播电台 (CNR) 援引当地农业局的消息报道。

;

;“具体情况仍在调查中……[包括]鳄鱼的具体数量，”中央广播电台表示。

;

;在中国饲养鳄鱼是为了获取它们的皮和肉，有时还用于传统医学。据央广网报道，灾区还建有“鳄鱼主题公园”和“全国最大的鳄鱼养殖基地”。

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 08:22:01 +0800 New mothers may have enhanced ability to see faces in objectshttps://www.theguardian.com/society/2023/sep/13/new-mothers-may-have-enhanced-ability-to-see-faces-in-things-research
;;2023-09-12T23:01:42Z;
;
;;一块吐司，其中有些人认为右边有耶稣的肖像
;

;无论是看到烤面包中的耶稣、奶酪刨丝器凹槽中的傻笑，或者只是月亮上的人，人类长期以来在意想不到的地方看到了面孔。

;

;现在研究人员表示，这种趋势可能不会被修复在成人中，这表明它在刚刚分娩的女性中似乎有所增强。

;

;科学家们认为，这一发现可能归因于产后女性体内催产素水平较高，俗称“爱”或“催产素”。 “信任”激素，因为它在社会联系中发挥着作用。

;

;“这些在线收集的数据表明，我们对面部模式的敏感度并不是固定的，并且可能在整个成年期发生变化，”该团队写道。< /p>;

;;在《Biology Letters》杂志上撰文;，澳大利亚昆士兰大学和昆士兰大学的研究人员阳光海岸描述了他们如何着手调查在无生命物体中看到面孔的倾向（一种称为面孔空想性的现象）是否会在生命过程中发生变化。

;

;;之前的研究;表明，当人类服用催产素时，他们识别;脸上的某些情绪增加;。因此，研究小组想要探索激素是否会影响个体对无生命物体中的面孔的敏感程度。

;

;研究人员使用一个在线平台来招募女性，参与者被问及是否愿意怀孕或刚刚分娩——后者是催产素水平普遍升高的时期。

;

;这些女性在网上随机观看了 320 张图像，并被要求以 11 分制评分他们很容易就能看到一张脸。其中 32 个图像是人脸，256 个图像是具有可以说类似于面部图案的无生命物体，32 个图像描绘的是没有这种面部图案的无生命物体。

;

;该团队从 84 个图像中收集了数据。孕妇、过去一年生育过的 79 名女性以及未报告怀孕或最近生育过的 216 名女性。

;
;

;;相关：;< a href="https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2021/jul/07/so-happy-to-see-you-our-brains-respond-emotionally-to-faces-we-find- in-inanimate-objects-study-reveals">;很高兴见到你：研究表明，我们的大脑会对在无生命物体中发现的面孔做出情感反应;

;
;

;结果表明所有参与者都很容易识别出人脸图像，但发现很难在 32 个缺乏面部图案的无生命物体图像中看到脸部。

;

;然而，最近生过孩子的女性表示能够看到256 比孕妇更容易出现幻觉面孔。

;

;研究小组表示，研究结果表明，对感知面孔的敏感性在整个成年期并不稳定，并且在为人父母早期会发生变化，可能是为了增加社会联系，并补充说这可能是由于催产素水平较高。

;

;但是，他们指出，由于没有测量参与者的催产素水平，因此结果可能可以用其他差异来解释，例如焦虑或压力水平。

; < p>;伦敦金史密斯大学心理学教授乔伊迪普·巴塔查里亚（Joydeep Bhattacharya）并未参与这项工作，他表示，期望新妈妈们增加面部处理能力以帮助她们解读婴儿的面部表情是有道理的。

; <但是，他说，这项研究并没有深入探讨产后妇女检测物体中的面孔的容易程度是否与这些面孔的婴儿般程度或她们被认为具有的表情有关，同时也没有测量催产素的水平，这使得我们不清楚激素是否确实参与其中。

;

;他补充说，这项研究仅在一个时间点进行，并没有追踪个人在观看物体前后看到面孔的倾向如何变化。宝贝，尽管巴塔查亚指出之前的研究显示个体之间的面部幻想性幻想存在巨大差异。

;

;“这些发现引起了人们的好奇心，”他说。 “但我们需要更可靠的复制和适当的测量才能得出可靠的结论。”

; Wed, 13 Sep 2023 07:52:01 +0800 Environmental activists killed at a rate of one every other day in 2022 – reporthttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/sep/13/environmental-activists-killed-at-a-rate-of-one-every-other-day-in-2022-global-witness-report-aoe
;;2023-09-12T23:01:43Z;
;
;;一名男子在针对前总统贾尔·博尔索纳罗的环境抗议中举着写着“Fora Ecocida”（生态灭绝）的牌子巴西巴西利亚，2022 年 4 月
;

;根据新数据，去年至少有 177 人因保护环境而被杀，其中五分之一的杀戮发生在亚马逊雨林。

;

;

;Apple 已宣布 iPhone 15 实现了期待已久的 USB-C 转换，同时为其最昂贵的 Pro 型号获得了更大的相机变焦能力。

;

;首席执行官于周二推出了 2023 年的新智能手机系列蒂姆·库克 (Tim Cook) 以及几款配备 USB-C 充电功能的新款 Apple Watch 和 AirPods Pro 2 耳机，该公司希望所有这些产品都能吸引客户更换或升级，并降低其最近推出的产品的价格。 com/technology/2023/sep/10/china-troubles-could-upset-apples-cart-as-it-prepares-to-launch-the-iphone-15">;股价下滑;。

;

;iPhone 15 和 15 Plus

; ;

;iPhone 15 的普通版和大号版类似于 ;即将推出的型号;采用铝制侧板，采用新的轮廓边缘、玻璃背面和正面。双摄像头系统具有显着改进的 48 兆像素主传感器，与去年的 14 Pro 型号类似，也提供 2 倍光学变焦。

;

;新型号还将具有更小的“动态岛”切口屏幕顶部取代了 ;去年的 14 Pro;。 It houses the selfie camera and Face ID system in a more aesthetically pleasing and useful segment capable of showing alerts. They also have screens that are twice as bright at 2,000nits for better outdoor readability.

;

;The USB-C port will enable charging and compatibility with adapters made for Macs, iPads, Android devices and PCs. It can also be used to directly charge AirPods or an Apple Watch from the handset. The phones will have the A16 chip that debuted in the Pros last year.

;

;The iPhone 15 will cost £799 in the UK ($799 in the US, $1,499 in Australia) and the 15 Plus £899 ($899, A$1,649) in store on 22 September.

;

;iPhone 15 Pro and 15 Pro Max

; ;

;The high-end versions of the iPhone gain the most upgrades this year. The 15 Pros have smaller bezels around the screen, frosted back glass and new titanium sides that replace the ;stainless steel of previous models;.

;

;The titanium makes the iPhones more durable and lighter, while a reworked 100% recycled aluminium internal design will make it easier to repair, matching the ;regular iPhone 14 models; from last year.

;

;The mute switch that has been on every model since the first iPhone in 2007 has also been replaced. The new action button is still capable of muting the phone, but also performing other actions such as switching focus modes or launching the camera.

;

;A new A17 Pro chip will boost performance, including a 20% faster GPU with ray tracing for games, while the USB-C port will have faster USB3 data speeds and connectivity.

;

;The iPhone 15 Pro will cost £999 ($999, A$1,849) and the 15 Pro Max £1,199 ($1,199, A$2,199) in store on 22 September.

;

;Apple Watch Series 9 and Ultra 2

; ;

;Apple's main smartwatch is seeing one of its biggest upgrades in years, although only on the inside. It also has greater amount of recycled materials, which the company says makes some versions carbon neutral in combination with offsets it purchases.

;

;The new watches will have Apple's first real processor upgrade since 2020 in the S9 chip, making the new watches faster and capable of processing common Siri requests locally. ;

;Apple's top smartwatch, the Ultra 2, also gets the faster S9 chip and new features, plus an even brighter 3,000nit screen for better outdoor readability. The case now uses 95% recycled titanium making it similarly carbon neutral.

;

;The Apple Watch Series 9 will cost £399 ($399, A$649) and the Watch Ultra Series 2 £799 ($799, A$1,399) in store on 22 September.

;

;While no journalism job is perfect, a new role posted by Gannett, the US media company, may just be a Taylor Swift fan's wildest dream.

;

;On Tuesday, a job simply titled “Taylor Swift reporter” appeared on the Gannett Careers' ;Dayforce site.; The desired reporter, who is being sought by both USA Today and the Tennessean, is to be “experienced, video-forward” and adept at capturing “the music and cultural impact of Taylor Swift”.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'She is a snake – in the most positive way!' How Taylor Swift became the world's biggest pop star, again;

;
;

;“Swift's fanbase has grown to unprecedented heights, and so has the significance of her music and growing legacy,” the posting reads. “We are looking for an energetic writer, photographer and social media pro who can quench an undeniable thirst for all things Taylor Swift with a steady stream of content across multiple platforms.”

;

;It added: “Seeing both the facts and the fury, the Taylor Swift reporter will identify why the pop star's influence only expands, what her fanbase stands for in pop culture, and the effect she has across the music and business worlds.”

;

;The role also requires the reporter to “chronicle the biggest moments on the next portions of Taylor Swift's tour” and travel internationally.

;

;Experienced journalists who have yet to see the Eras tour, perhaps this is your biggest break yet.

;

;In a statement to the Guardian, a spokesperson for Gannett confirmed that the role was real, full-time and with benefits.

;

;“Are you ready for it? Being essential to our readers means providing the content they crave and we have a blank space with Taylor's name,” said Kristin Roberts, Gannett media chief content officer.

;

;As most Swift-centric things tend to do, the role made the rounds on the website X, formerly known as Twitter, on Tuesday afternoon. One person simply called the role ;“incredible”;, while ;another quipped;: “heaven help whoever has to review applications for that Taylor swift reporter job”.

;

;Music critic Carl Wilson ;noted ;the unusual nature of the job and posed the question: “Has anyone ever heard of a single-artist reporter job before?”

;

;Gannett employs more than 11,000 people and is the largest US newspaper publisher “as measured by total daily circulation”, per the ;Library of Congress;. This viral job posting comes in the wake of the company undergoing several rounds of layoffs in the last year, resulting in hundreds of workers being let go or furloughed.

;

;Gannett also recently saw a “mass exodus among top leadership”, according to ;Poynter.;

;

;Longtime Swift fans will probably be unsurprised that a Taylor Swift Reporter role exists, particularly in the wake of other Swift-forward positions that have cropped up in the past. Brittany Spanos, a Rolling Stone senior writer who ;teaches a class; specifically on Swift at the Clive Davis Institute of Recorded Music at New York University, even offered a word of advice for Gannett.

;

;“There's a lot of exciting things happening in the Taylor Swift universe but there's even more happening in the world of music worth covering,” Spanos said. “They would be better off hiring a full-time music journalist to do that.”

;The speaker of the US House of Representatives, Kevin McCarthy, on Tuesday announced that Republicans would open an impeachment investigation into Joe Biden over unproven allegations of corruption in his family's business dealings.

;

;The announcement by McCarthy kicks off what are expected to be weeks of Republican-led hearings intended to convince Americans that the president profited from the business dealings of his son Hunter Biden and other family members, but it is unclear if the GOP has the evidence to substantiate the long-running claims, or even the votes for impeachment.

;

;The campaign comes as McCarthy tries to hang on to his position as leader of Congress's lower chamber, despite a mere four-seat Republican majority and rising discontent among its most extreme conservative lawmakers, who are upset over a deal McCarthy reached with Biden to raise the debt ceiling while cutting some government spending, and ;have demanded recompense; in the form of an impeachment inquiry.

;
;

;;Related: ;;'Don't panic!' say leading Democrats as Biden's age and poor polls cast pall;

;
;

;“House Republicans have uncovered serious and credible allegations into President Biden's conduct. Taken together, these allegations paint a picture of a culture of corruption,” McCarthy announced as lawmakers in Congress's lower chamber resumed work following a month-long recess in August.

;

;“I am directing our House committee to open a formal impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden.这一合乎逻辑的下一步将使我们的委员会拥有为美国公众收集所有事实和答案的全部权力。 That's exactly what we want to know – the answers. I believe the president would want to answer these questions and allegations as well,” McCarthy said.

;

;While impeachment can be the first step to removing a president from office, that appears unlikely to happen. If the House impeaches Biden, the matter would then go to the Senate, which would have to support his conviction with a two-thirds majority – a high bar to clear in a chamber currently controlled by Democrats. The White House spokesman Ian Sams called McCarthy's announcement “extreme politics at its worst”.

;

;“House Republicans have been investigating the President for 9 months, and they've turned up no evidence of wrongdoing[.] His own GOP members have said so[.] He vowed to hold a vote to open impeachment, now he flip flopped because he doesn't have support,” Sams wrote on Twitter.

;

;The impeachment inquiry will be handled by the oversight, judiciary and ways and means committees, all of which are controlled by McCarthy allies and since the start of the year have spent much of their time trying to make corruption allegations against the president stick.

;

;In a sign of the paucity of the results of their efforts, ;reports indicate; McCarthy does not yet have enough votes in support of impeaching Biden. Earlier this month, the speaker ;told Breitbart News;, “If we move forward with an impeachment inquiry, it would occur through a vote on the floor of the People's House and not through a declaration by one person,” but backtracked on Tuesday, making no mention of holding a vote to start the investigation.

;

;The corruption allegations against the president have generally focused on his son Hunter, who has been under federal investigation since 2018. In July, the collapse of a plea agreement he reached with prosecutors to resolve charges related to failing to pay his income taxes for two years and lying about using drugs when buying a gun. Last week, prosecutors said ;Hunter Biden could be indicted; on the gun charge by the end of the month.

;

;Republicans insist that Joe Biden illicitly profited from his son's business dealings overseas, but have yet to turn up proof. In July, Hunter Biden's former business partner Devon Archer ;spoke behind closed doors; to the House oversight committee, and said the younger Biden would sometimes put his father on speakerphone during meetings.

;

;But the former vice-president “never once spoke about any business dealings”, Archer said, adding that he felt Hunter was trying to create an “illusion of access” to his father as he pursued deals in Ukraine.
